sentences: Me, tüürmann, kurat, murrame su kaela, / kui sa veel julged iitsata!
context: The word 'julged' is a verb form (past participle) of the verb 'julgema', which means 'to dare' or 'to have the courage to'. In the example sentence from J. Smuul, it appears in the context 'kui sa veel julged iitsata!' meaning 'if you still dare to swear!'. The word shows that someone has the bravery or audacity to do something difficult or risky.
